author: William Leigh
method: Heat a dry frying pan over a medium heat. Add the pine nuts and toast them for a few minutes until browned and fragrant.  Place the parmesan chunks in a food processor and add the basil leaves, garlic, toasted pine nuts and olive oil.  Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper.  Blend for a few seconds until it begins to come together and is smooth. Taste the pesto for seasoning, and add a squeeze of lemon juice if you like. If not using straight away, you can store the pesto in a jar and will keep for a week in the fridge. Or you can put it into ice-cube trays and freeze.
ingredients: 125g/4½oz pine nuts,  125g/4½oz parmesan cheese (or a similar vegetarian hard cheese), cut into small chunks,  1 large bunch fresh basil leaves,  1 clove garlic, crushed with the flat side of a knife,  200ml/7fl oz extra virgin olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  squeeze lemon juice
